title: Ensure full body background image is visible (contain + safe positioning)

requirements.summary: Switch the global body background from cover to contain (mobile + desktop) without changing existing background image variables or repeat behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile (<768px), the full background image is visible without any cropping.
On desktop (>=768px), the full background image is visible without any cropping.
The existing background image sources referenced via `--bg-image-mobile` and `--bg-image-desktop` remain unchanged.
The background does not tile (no-repeat remains in effect).

file_operations.description: Update the global `body` background styling to use `background-size: contain` instead of `background-size: cover`, ensuring the rule applies across breakpoints. Keep existing `background-image` references via `--bg-image-mobile` / `--bg-image-desktop` unchanged, and preserve `background-repeat: no-repeat`.

requirements.summary: Adjust global body background-position (mobile + desktop) so contain-scaled images stay fully within the viewport and look centered/appropriate.
acceptanceCriteria: After the change to `background-size: contain`, the background-position settings do not result in any part of the background image being clipped outside the viewport.
The background remains visually centered/appropriate on both mobile and desktop breakpoints.

file_operations.description: Revise the `background-position` values for `body` (default/mobile) and within the `@media (min-width: 768px)` rule to remove large positional offsets (e.g., inch-based calc shifts) that could push the contained image off-screen. Prefer centered positions (or other viewport-safe values) so the entire image remains visible at both breakpoints.
